summary:
**Meeting Overview**:  
The City Plan Commission of Dallas will convene on May 2, 2024, for a briefing at 9:00 AM followed by public hearings starting at 12:30 PM. The meeting will be held in the Council Chambers at City Hall and via videoconference. The primary purpose is to discuss various zoning cases, minor amendments, and other planning matters.

**Key Agenda Items**:  
The agenda includes briefings on the ForwardDallas Comprehensive Land Use Plan, approval of previous meeting minutes, and a series of zoning and subdivision cases. Notable items include minor amendments to existing development plans, multiple zoning cases for various districts, and applications for specific use permits.

**Important Details**:  
Significant proposals include amendments to Planned Development Districts, applications for specific use permits for alcohol sales, and requests for zoning changes to accommodate mixed-use developments. The commission will also consider residential replats and building line removals.

**Action Items**:  
The commission seeks approvals for various zoning cases, including amendments to existing permits and new applications for specific use permits, as well as minor amendments to development plans. The agenda also includes a public hearing authorization regarding zoning for an open-enrollment charter school. Decisions on these matters will guide future development and land use in Dallas.
